SEARCH
Module fi.tuni.prog3.weatherapp
Package fi.tuni.prog3.weatherapp

Class WeatherAPICall

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.prog3.weatherapp.WeatherAPICall
public class WeatherAPICall extends Object
The WeatherAPICall class contains methods to interact with the OpenWeatherMap API and retrieve various weather-related data such as current weather, historical weather, forecast, moon phase information, and weather-related images. It provides functionality to generate descriptive texts and retrieve image paths based on specific weather parameters and indices.
Since:
2023-12-06
Version:
1.0
Author:
Nguyen Quang Duc

  • Method Details

    • RequestHistocialWeatherData

      public static HistoricalWeatherResponse RequestHistocialWeatherData()
      Makes a request to retrieve historical weather data from the OpenWeatherMap API. Uses latitude, longitude, API key, chosen units, and a specific date/time to fetch historical weather information.
      Returns:
      HistoricalWeatherResponse containing the requested historical weather data. Returns null if an error occurs during the retrieval process.

    • InitializeHistoricalWeatherRequest

      public static void InitializeHistoricalWeatherRequest()
      Initializes the historical weather request object if it's currently null. Creates a new instance of HistoricalWeatherRequest and assigns it to the global variable.

    • RequestCurrentWeatherData

      public static CurrentWeatherResponse RequestCurrentWeatherData()
      Makes a request to retrieve current weather data from the OpenWeatherMap API. Uses latitude, longitude, and API key to fetch current weather information.
      Returns:
      CurrentWeatherResponse containing the requested current weather data. Returns null if an error occurs during the retrieval process.

    • InitializeCurrentWeatherRequest

      public static void InitializeCurrentWeatherRequest()
      Initializes the current weather request object if it's currently null. Creates a new instance of CurrentWeatherRequest and assigns it to the global variable.

    • RequestCurrentAndForecastWeatherData

      public static CurrentAndForecastWeatherResponse RequestCurrentAndForecastWeatherData()
      Makes a request to retrieve both current and forecast weather data from the OpenWeatherMap API. Uses latitude, longitude, API key, chosen units, and exclusion parameters to fetch weather information.
      Returns:
      CurrentAndForecastWeatherResponse containing the requested current and forecast weather data. Returns null if an error occurs during the retrieval process.

    • InitializeForecastWeatherRequest

      public static void InitializeForecastWeatherRequest()
      Initializes the forecast weather request object if it's currently null. Creates a new instance of CurrentAndForecastWeatherRequest and assigns it to the global variable.

    • VisibilityTextGenerator

      public static String VisibilityTextGenerator(int visibilityIndex)
      Generates text based on the given visibility index.
      Parameters:
      visibilityIndex - The index representing visibility conditions.
      Returns:
      String indicating the visibility status based on the index.

    • UVITextGenerator

      public static String UVITextGenerator(int UVIndex)
      Generates text based on the given UV index.
      Parameters:
      UVIndex - The UV index representing UV radiation levels.
      Returns:
      String indicating the UV index status based on the given value.

    • MoonPhaseTextGenerator

      public static String MoonPhaseTextGenerator(double value)
      Generates text describing the moon phase based on the given value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value representing the phase of the moon.
      Returns:
      String describing the moon phase based on the given value.

    • MoonPhaseImagePath

      public static String MoonPhaseImagePath(double value)
      Retrieves the image path for the moon phase based on the given value.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      String indicating the file path of the moon phase image based on the given value.
